content: I'm not clear on exactly what you're asking (if you want to change something in Thunderbird or Yahoo), but if you want to switch from POP to IMAP within Thunderbird see this article: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/.../switch-pop-imap-account.
creator: Duncan

content: I have seen many having trouble restoring from Carbonite (and other backup products). If the backup was done while Thunderbird was running, the profile may be corrupt. I presume thunderbird was able to start with the profile restored, but some components failed? The addressbook can usually be restored with tools>import>import from a file and proceed from there until you get to a menu with 'sqlite' as an option. Then, select the file named abook.sqlite from your backup. For further assistance, please provide more detail on what is missing.
creator: davidsk

content: If you want the draft to be deleted after sending, I suggest setting Draft folder to use Local Folders. When using IMAP, thunderbird periodically issues a save, sometimes resulting in multiple copies. When sent, a delete is sent, but extra copies will remain.

content:
Okay, searching around I found how to turn on “troubleshooting mode”, and selected to turn off all add-ons.

I now get the actual email interface, with buttons, various inboxes and controls that were all gone from the application before.

Such a relief.

Now I wonder what “add-ons” were there, and how to get rid of them permanently. I would rather simply be able to use the email client again.
creator: frisbin

content:
So, I tried what the instructions say, to disable an extension or “add-on” and see if that makes it better. The problem with this instruction, is when you start Thunderbird in troubleshooting mode, it takes away any extensions that may have been there, and gives no indication of what has been disabled.

I poked around and only see “System theme — auto” default-theme@mozilla.org

I found that perhaps the “troubleshooting mode” is persistent, since now I can close and open Thunderbird normally and the application seems to be working now.

I have doubts that it really is okay now, but will try to keep using it. I wonder if I should seek out a different email application in order to have more reliability.

content: Server SMPT Parametri di connessione sono Porta 587 (Impostazione server Porta 110) - Sicurezza della connessione STARTTLS - Metodo di autenticazione Password normale. Il messaggio di errore è "Connessione al server mail.fioriperlanima.com fuori tempo massimo" La versione di Thunderbird Version 128.5.1esr | Released December 2, 2024 Antivirus Norton, ma lo avevo anche prima che nascesse questo problema
creator: antonella.napoli

content:
Connessione al server fuori tempo massimo significa che il server non risponde alla richiesta che Thunderbird invia. Non conoscendo il tuo hosting provider non so dirti se i parametri che stai usando siano corretti o meno, in particolare non mi è chiara la parte tra parentesi (Impostazione server Porta 110) visto che la porta se hai un 110 non è tipica del protocollo SMTP. Un link alla guida del tuo provider potrebbe essere utile.

Comunque se il problema è il server che non risponde allora andrebbe risolto dal tuo hosting provider. Una prova ad antivirus disattivato la farei comunque (ogni volta che si aggiorna, un antivirus cambia modo di lavorare per cui che prima non abbia dato problema potrebbe non significare nulla).

content:
iCloud and other providers contacts and calendars can be synced with the built-in CardDAV and CalDAV options. Click the 3-bar menu icon, New Account, then choose Calendar or New Address Book, and use these URLs for the location:

https://contacts.icloud.com https://caldav.icloud.com

iCloud requires an app password in place of the account password.

https://discourse.gnome.org/t/gnome-settings-carddav-caldav-icloud-account/22859

Similar process with e.g. Google calendars and contacts.

content: Offering up a different opinion, I think that asking the documentation folks to consider having Knowledge Base articles with this information easily accessible is not a bad idea. That way, when folks ask a question about one of the topics in this thread, it would be easy to point to the KB rather than pointing to this thread and saying, "Well, here's one way that someone else figured out how to do that."
creator: TLRS

content: That is what we generally do, focus on a specific concern. Most new users need assistance in one or two topics and then explore as they learn more. One of the challenges is keeping the knowledge base current, as new releases provide different options. I appreciate your feedback.

content: Sometimes there are interruptions to thunderbird from other sources, such as antivirus. Your profile may still be there with all content. You can see that by these steps: - click help>troubleshootinginformation - scroll down to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder' - you are now in profile, in windows file explorer, click back one folder so that you are in the 'profiles' folder Is there more than one profile showing? If so, browse the content of both. Yours will have account info in either the imapmail folder or the mail folder. If you confirm the right profile, your next steps are these: - in thunderbird, click help>troubleshootinginformation - scroll down to 'profiles' and click 'about:profiles' - click the 'create profile' button - click 'next' - enter a short nickname, such as LOSTPROFILE and then click the 'choose' button to locate and select the profile you discovered, then click finish and launch.
creator: davidsk

content:
I created two groups under News

There are no newsgroups in your screenshot. Are you talking about the two feed accounts?

I can't delete both of the news groups and their Trash folders from the tab listing.

These are accounts, not "news groups". To delete an account: Press Alt or F10 in case the menu bar is hidden.

From the main menu bar: Tools - Account Settings Select the account to be deleted in the left pane. Select 'Remove Account' from the 'Account Action' drop-down menu at the bottom.

There are addons which can help with removing duplicates https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/removedupes/ 3. Is this imap account or pop? 4. Make sure your antivirus software excludes Thunderbird profile directory 5. Make sure you have backups.

content: 1. use https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/removedupes/ to download the addon 2. start Windows in safe mode with networking enabled - https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/12376/windows-10-start-your-pc-in-safe-mode 3. disable your network 4. start Thunderbird 5. for each account go to account settings > server settings and make sure the two items below "Message Storage" are unchecked (not enabled) 6. install the addon - tools > add-ons > Extensions > click the gear > Install Add-on from file 7. run the add-on to remove duplicates 8. check to make sure everything is good 9. right+click on trash folder and empty trash, do same to spam folder 10. enable your network 11. proceed to delete a few of your larger messages
creator: wsmwk
